body: @Drekin, any ideas? I thought all the std\* streams got initialised with a utf-8 encoding.
The default streams provided by WUC have UTF-8 encoding, but during exit many things can happen. It would be useful to know the actual values of `sys.stdin` and `sys.stdout` during the event.

I think this is from us calling `input()` to ask the user 'are you sure you want to quit', so before the interpreter is actually shutting down. @bjonen, do you get the same warnings if you run `input()` (or `raw_input()`, if you're on Python 2)?

I generated a new conda environment and the problem disappeared. In fact the same error comes up when I call raw_input(). I am not sure what the particular problem in this environment is. Here is a list of installed packages.

Thanks. Can you try upgrading to IPython 5.1? We made a couple of changes that may have affected it.
Oh,  and for good measure, upgrade `prompt_toolkit` to the latest release.
